title: Baire space (set theory)
summary: In set theory, the Baire space is the set of all infinite sequences of natural numbers with a certain topology.  This space is commonly used in descriptive set theory, to the extent that its elements are often called "reals". It  is denoted NN, ωω, by the symbol N {\displaystyle {\mathcal {N}}} or also ωω, not to be confused with the countable ordinal obtained by ordinal exponentiation.
